meanings.sent1: The judge's ruling favored the plaintiff in the court case.
meanings.sent2: The Supreme Court's ruling set a new precedent for future cases.
meanings.sent3: The ruling of the judge left everyone in the courtroom surprised.
meanings.sent4: Her ruling on the matter was final, and no one dared to challenge it.
meanings.sent5: The ruling of the jury echoed through the silent courtroom.

meanings.definition: The act of exercising control or authority.
meanings.sent1: His ruling over the company was firm but fair.
meanings.sent2: The king's ruling over the kingdom was absolute.
meanings.sent3: The ruling of the teacher in the classroom kept the students in line.
meanings.sent4: Her ruling over the household was like that of a queen.
meanings.sent5: The ruling of the coach motivated the team to work harder.

meanings.definition: A strip of material with straight edges used for measuring and drawing straight lines.
meanings.sent1: She used a ruling to draw a perfect line on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The architect relied on a ruling to ensure precise measurements.
meanings.sent3: The ruling slipped from the desk and caused a mess on the floor.
meanings.sent4: His ruler broke, so he had to use a ruling for his geometry homework.
meanings.sent5: The ruling helped her create neat graphs for her science project.
